html:
The only retention of significance in the Book of Mormon is in verse 6, the last phrase of which states "and let not this ruin come under thy hand."

When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, saying, Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let this ruin be under thy hand: (Isaiah 3:6.)

When a man shall take hold of his brother of the house of his father, and shall say: Thou hast clothing, be thou our ruler, and let not this ruin come under thy hand— (2 Ne. 13:6.)

The KJV has lost the word "not," which points to a desire to escape the coming ruin. This is apparently similar to the situation which came upon the wicked Nephites four years before the Savior visited them. The people divided one against the other and separated into tribes according to families, kindreds, and friends, not as a righteous patriarchal division but as an attempt for survival. (See 3 Ne. 7:1-14.)
